instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2338: What is A2338? A2338 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2020 M1, Mid 2022 M2 with EMC 8162, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-02020, 820-02773..
definitions.820-02020: What is 820-02020? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook won’t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-11no power
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-11 that only has 5V on ampmeter, it is recognized in DFU, but it gives an error when restoring in DFU mode:
"Gave up waiting for device to transition from DFU state to DFU state.  [com.apple.MobileDevice.MobileRestore – 0xFCA (4042)]"

Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-11no power
threads.message:
Any history available?

Be sure the machine takes current from charger, before connecting DFU cable.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-11no power
threads.message:
Hi,

Client says that it stoped working overnight, and It has no signs of oxidation nither of liquid contact.

It puls 0A (didn't know that it needed to take power before DFU). However, now, one of the ports puls 19.8V from ampmeter (sometimes it puls 5V and 0.40A on that same port), and 5V and 0A (always) on the other port.

Not sure what this means, but when conecting power cable to the UF500 port, FF201 stays at 0V, but CF501 keeps with 5V.

When conecting to the UF400 port, both (CF401 and FF200) stays at 5V.

Both fuses are ok, and both have 5V when using UF400 port.

Can it be a bad UF500? If yes, how can I be sure?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-11no power
threads.message:
If USB-C ports have different behavior, then you have problems in USB-C area.
You can compare diode mode readings around <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> chips.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-11no power
threads.message:
Hi,

The culprit was UF500.

TKS!
